lj.lj_ly: I'm not a hundred per cent sure.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Old English, from hund 'hundred' (from an Indo-European root shared with Latin centum and Greek hekaton) + a second element meaning 'number'; of Germanic origin and related to Dutch honderd and German hundert. The noun sense 'subdivision of a county' is of uncertain origin: it may originally have been equivalent to a hundred hides of land (see hide)

entry.def: A hundred or one hundred is the number 100.

example.ex: According to one official more than a hundred people have been arrested.
example.tran: 一名官员称有一百多人被捕。

entry.def: If you refer to hundreds of things or people, you are emphasizing that there are very many of them.

example.ex: Hundreds of tree species face extinction...
example.tran: 许许多多树种濒临灭绝。

example.ex: Today you can buy hundreds of flavours of ice-cream.
example.tran: 如今你可以买到很多种口味的冰激凌。

entry.def: You can use a hundred per cent or one hundred per cent to emphasize that you agree completely with something or that it is completely right or wrong.

example.ex: Are you a hundred per cent sure it's your neighbour?...
example.tran: 你百分之百肯定是你的邻居吗？

example.ex: I agree with you one hundred per cent.

list.explanation: 力大无比的人，强大的力量，无时抵御的影晌

example.en: He is a 600-hundred-pound gorilla. He can intimidate anybody.
We are all subject to nine-hundred-pound gorilla from the mass media.
example.zh: 我们都受着大众传媒不可抵御的影响。

Sentence.sentence: The sword hasn't had a military function for a hundred years, but is still part of an officer's full-dress uniform, precisely because a sword always symbolized "an officer and a gentleman.
This is necessary because full-time students probably have to read several hundred pages every week.
The biggest problem with traditional print textbooks is that they cost hundreds of dollars every semester.
Her son Doug is one of several hundred thousand high-school seniors who had a painful fall.
Today many universities require their applicants to write an essay of up to five hundred words
Compared with a hundred years ago, our lives are less tightly bound by social norms and physical constraints.

sentences.en: I could give you a hundred reasons for not going.
sentences.cn: 我可以给你说出一百个不去的理由。

sentences.en: How many hundreds are there in thousand?
Hundreds of people were killed in the earthquake.
sentences.cn: 那次地震中有数百人死亡。

jushi.english: There were one hundred people in the room.
I could give you a hundred reasons for not going.
jushi.chinese: 我可以给你说出一百个不去的理由。
